hotspots.label: Snake Body
hotspots.fact: This snake has scales that overlap like roof tiles to protect its body. Snakes use their long, flexible bodies to move through grass and hide from predators in their environment.

hotspots.label: Snake Head
hotspots.fact: A snake's head contains special sense organs that help it find food and navigate. Snakes can sense heat and smell using special pits and organs in their face.

hotspots.label: Dried Plant Matter
hotspots.fact: Snakes live in habitats with dead leaves and wood because these materials provide hiding spots and shelter. The camouflage from this brown environment helps snakes stay safe from larger animals.

hotspots.label: Natural Habitat
hotspots.fact: This snake's brown coloring is perfect for blending in with dead grass and wood, called camouflage. This adaptation helps snakes hunt for food and escape from danger in nature.
